title: The Big Bang Theory star Kaley Cuoco’s Harley Quinn series gets release date
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

DC Universe’s new animated series, Harley Quinn, has received its official release date and it can’t come soon enough.

According to Entertainment Weekly, it’s coming out 29 November on the DC Universe streaming service in the US.

There’s no word yet on a UK release date with DC Universe not available to the rest of the world, so we’ll have to hope another platform perhaps picks up the rights.

A previous trailer for the irreverent new animated series promised viewers are going to ‘p**s’ themselves when they watch it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Big Bang Theory’s Kaley Cuoco voices the titular DC villain in the adult animation series, taking on her first role since wrapping on the geeky sitcom after twelve years.

‘The nice thing is that most of the time she’s going up against villains who are worse than her,’ she told Deadline. ‘So you root for her in that way.’

The star continued: ‘She is a killer but those who are dying in her hands deserve it.’

Harley Quinn is being led by showrunners Paul Dini and Bruce Tomm, with Alan Tudyk voicing The Joker, Diedrich Bader starring as Batman and Lake Bell playing Poison Ivy.

This isn’t the only project Kaley has been working on, as she recently landed the lead role in the upcoming thriller The Flight Attendant.

Confirming the news in a statement, the actress spoke about how excited she was for her latest project.

‘I love that Warner Bros. is my home away from home,’ Kaley beamed. ‘I couldn’t be more excited to continue this incredibly collaborative and gratifying relationship.’

Harley Quinn launches on DC Universe in the US on 29 November.

description: DC Universe's animated series, Harley Quinn, starring Kaley Cuoco finally as a release date and we can't wait
